title: DOCKER_MODS= on arm64 image?
body:
is the DOCKER_MODS=calibre still needed? i saw a commit that removed it but seems to be for amd64 only?

I'm running on arm64 rock-5b board
author: Fuckingnameless

comments.body: Oh, you are right, no need for the calibre MODS anymore, I am offloading that to CWA instead :P

But its if you are using the arm version
Which is still not rolled out to `:latest` docker
Its for the`CF_BYPASS` branch for now

eh sorry i confused repos, meant to ask on CWA's, so you're saying i need a DOCKER_MOD on your image too? or only on crocodilestick's?

i just tested his latest image with your CF_Bypass branch and everything seems to be working even PDF ingest/conversion

No you dont need it in any of the repos, it was too cumbersome and I dropped it and he implemented it directly in the containers.

So no, you dont need the DOCKER_MODS anymore

> But its if you are using the arm version Which is still not rolled out to `:latest` docker Its for the`CF_BYPASS` branch for now

just confirming
 it is NOT needed for any branch right?
Exact, DOCKER_MODS is not needed for CWA-BD (or CWA anymore)

title: Improve Mobile Usability, pan right in results to see the buttons
body: I know designing for mobile is probably a huge can of worms.  But there are times when using my phone is more convenient, and when I try to use it I can initiate a search which is great.  But the results are usually unusable, since I cannot fully pan over to the right where the buttons are.  If even that one piece could somehow be fixed when using the mobile, being able to click detail/download or fully read the results, that would be great.
author: yroyathon

comments.body: Ran into this issue as well. Should be ideally a one/few line change.
Try repulling your docker image, I submitted (and had approved) a PR to resolve this.
Hooray it's fixed!  I'm on iPhone mobile/safari.  Thank you, this is great!

title: Best approach to change ports?
body:
Wondering best approach to remap ports for both the main app and the cloudflare proxy?  Tried using the ENV variables, that didn't work (still used 8084 and 8000), tried remapping ports directly and that seemed to work but couldn't connect to the Cloudflare proxy w/localhost or got errors using an IP instead (connection refused).  

Guessing I'm just doing something incorrect, but would see shifting ports as a pretty big need for many.
author: necromancyr

comments.body:
You are totally correct
I messed up my docker compose,
Its fixed now, see #13
To map the ports for cloudflarebypassforscraping service should just add port maps under there, correct?  That's the other part - both ports need to be modifiable.

Sadly, cloudflarebypassforscraping port can't be changed, it's hardcoded from their service
But it shouldn't matter, since we are not exposing it
Its only used internally, and by hostname so you can have another service in your compose using the same port and it will work fine

Why are you trying to change the port ?

Thanks - you answered my question.  I was overthinking it and trying to remap more than I needed to.  Thanks!  This is addressed and working great!  (Now I just need a UI element in CWA to link to this! :))

I am talking with the creator of CWA about that :P 
For now I have a hack where I apply inject the button in the HTML before spinning the CWA docker, I might clean it up a bit and share it next week
